text: right Jonkheer Willem van Haren (February 21, 1710 – July 4, 1768) was a Dutch nobleman and poet.http://www.infoplease.com/ce6/people/A0822720.html Van Haren was born in Leeuwarden. His best-known work was an epic poem, Friso, created in 1741. His brother, jhr. Onno Zwier van Haren, was also a poet and wrote patriotic verses. Willem van Haren died in Sint-Oedenrode. ==References== Category:1710 births Category:1768 deaths Category:18th-century Dutch writers Category:Dutch male poets Category:Dutch critics Category:Dutch diplomats Category:Dutch nobility Category:People from Leeuwarden Category:18th-century Dutch poets Category:18th-century male writers
title: Willem van Haren
